quoteFirst: The delivery at Cleveland and Boston will be reduced to some sixteen hours, and to New York some six hours. Letters mailed in New York City in time for the train leaving at
quoteLast: will reach Chicago in time for the 3 o’clock carrier delivery instead of the following morning carrier delivery, as would be the case if sent all the way by train.
title: Aircraft
author: David, Evan John, 1877-1961

quoteLast: , flies within 5 mile circle and continues to Lichfield, arriving 8.10 P. M. (117 miles). Grahame-White starts from Wormwood Scrubs, London, at 6.29 P.
title:
How It Flies; or, The Conquest of the Air
The Story of Man's Endeavors to Fly and of the Inventions by Which He Has Succeeded
author: Ferris, Richard

quoteLast: , on April 27th, he went up from Hendon and had travelled 50 miles when Grahame White, informed of his rival's start, set out to overtake him. Before nightfall Paulhan landed at Lichfield, 117 miles from London, while Grahame White had to come down at Roden, only 60 miles out.
title: A History of Aeronautics
author: Vivian, Evelyn Charles, 1882-1947; Marsh, W. Lockwood (William Lockwood), 1886-1963

quoteFirst: Louis Paulhan, who had just arrived with his Farman machine, immediately got it unpacked and put together in order to be ready to make his attempt for the prize as soon as the weather conditions should admit. At
quoteLast: , on April 27th, he went up from Hendon and had travelled 50 miles when Grahame White, informed of his rival’s start, set out to overtake him. Before nightfall Paulhan landed at Lichfield, 117 miles from London, while Grahame White had to come down at Roden, only 60 miles out.
title: A History of Aeronautics
